helpfulResource.displayText: When zone awareness is enabled, OpenSearch Service allocates the nodes and replica index shards across two or three Availability Zones in the same AWS Region.

improvementPlan.displayText: Zone awareness helps prevent downtime and data loss.

questions.title: Do you understand Amazon OpenSearch Service quotas?
questions.description: Your AWS account has default quotas, formerly referred to as limits, for each AWS service.

choices.title: Amazon OpenSearch Service domain and instance quotas.

helpfulResource.displayText: Understand the Amazon OpenSearch Service domain and instance quotas in your Region.

improvementPlan.displayText: Open the Service Quotas console to view the quotas for OpenSearch Service.

choices.title: Adjust Amazon OpenSearch Service domain and instance quotas.

helpfulResource.displayText: Understand what Amazon OpenSearch Service domain and instance quotas can be adjusted.

improvementPlan.displayText: Request a quota increase in your Region.

questions.title: Do you use EC2 instance type T-class in production environment?
questions.description: Avoid using T2 or t3.small instances for the production environment.

choices.title: Avoid using T-class instances for the production environment.

helpfulResource.displayText: Avoid using T-class instances for production domains because they can become unstable under sustained heavy load.

improvementPlan.displayText: For production environments, use other EC2 instances instead of T-class.
